normalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I've been thinking a lot about film festivals. Back in the day, you'd think "film festival" and imagine some super-serious, black-and-white, three-hour-long movie nobody actually *enjoys*, right? But trust me, times have changed!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I've been thinking a lot about film festivals. Back in the day, you'd think "film festival" and imagine some super-serious, black-and-white, three-hour-long movie nobody actually *enjoys*, right? But trust me, times have changed!
normalised: These days, film festivals are seriously cool. They're not just for the artsy types anymore. I mean, sure, you’ll still find your share of thought-provoking dramas, but you also get amazing indie comedies, edge-of-your-seat thrillers, and even Bollywood-inspired masala flicks! I remember seeing this crazy action-comedy at the Kolkata International Film Festival last year – totally unexpected, but a complete riot!

normalised: Think of it as a movie treasure hunt. You get to discover films you'd never find at your local P V R. Plus, you often get to meet the filmmakers and actors! Imagine chatting with the director about the inspiration behind his debut feature! That's something you won't get at a regular screening, na?

normalised: And it's not just about the movies. Film festivals are a total *vibe*. They're a place to connect with other film lovers, debate the merits of different films over cups of chai, and maybe even network if you're looking to break into the industry yourself. They are organised in different cities, like I F F I in Goa. It’s a serious talent hub.

normalised: From Cannes to the tiny little festivals in your own city, there’s a film festival for everyone. They can cost anywhere from rupees five hundred for a single screening to rupees five thousand for a full festival pass. So ditch your usual Netflix binge this weekend, find a film festival near you, and discover your new favourite movie. Trust me, you won’t regret it! Maybe you'll even see the next "three Idiots" before it blows up! You never know!
